H0.text: Nuclear symbols represent radioactive nuclei and particles.

H1.text: Energy is the symbol that represents radioactive nuclei and particles.

H2.text: Greek symbols represent radioactive nuclei and particles.

H3.text: Compound is the symbol used to represent radioactive nuclei and particles.

A4.text: The symbol for the alpha particle is α or α2+.

A5.text: Alpha particles are named after the first letter in the Greek alphabet, α.

A6.text: A beta particle, also called beta ray or beta radiation (symbol β)

A7.text: The gray (Gy) is the SI unit of absorbed dose, which is the amount of radiation energy deposited in the irradiated material.
